title: MacBook Pro A1502 820-3476-A 2014 - NO DISPLAY
message:
Hello dear friends!
I bought Macbook Pro 2014 from ebay that was dead, there was missing D7010 and there was no green light on charger, after fixing that there is no chime i'm not sure is sound working or not, also there is a short circuit on battery rail, but that is also not my main concern....

There is no display, I have output on HDMI out and device is working properly (without sound and battery) but screen doesn't turn on.
I have measured 52 V on
[TABLE]
[TR]
[TD]1[/TD]
[TD]PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT[/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]

5V on
[TABLE]
[TR]
[TD]28[/TD]
[TD]PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD[/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]

I will measure resistance and voltage drop on every pin of J8300 today.
I replaced this - U7700 U8330 U8300, C8352.
Any advice where should I look next?
Also can you replace PCH with just hot air station or you need BGA station?

Thanks in advance.

title: MacBook Pro A1502 820-3476-A 2014 - NO DISPLAY
message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

52V on backlight output, denotes open circuit to the LEDs strip.
Check J8300 first and test with known good compatible LCD assembly.

Do not try to change a PCH without proper equipment (BGA rework station).
I hope you don't want to change it on this board.

title: MacBook Pro A1502 820-3476-A 2014 - NO DISPLAY
message:
Hi,


motherboard works fine on hdmi output, so I suppose that PCH is fine.
Under the microscope I saw that screen connector is damaged, in diode mode while testing connector I measured some 0.09 OHM-s that I'm worry about, how to test the screen, do you know what should be the measurement on screen connector pins on diode mode (red on ground ?) or in ohms?
I'm just starting so I have parts for few older MacBooks. 
LP133WQ1 SJ E1 DCN441406G1FF0H0 LGD 133DA51903DJF 913B are the numbers on the screen.

title: MacBook Pro A1502 820-3476-A 2014 - NO DISPLAY
message:
"in diode mode while testing connector I measured some 0.09 OHM-s"
Where did you note such low values?
Switch to ohm scale, instead of diode mode, for very low resistance.

Replace LCD connector, if looks bad.
It could be the culprit and nothing else damaged.

title: MacBook Pro A1502 820-3476-A 2014 - NO DISPLAY
message:
Tomorrow I will buy new cable, and I will replace J8300 before testing new cable, I will let you know what happens!
I got sound working so only problem will be short in battery circuit if screen is working.

Thank you so much this is best forum ever, fast reply with good advices so awesome.

If I will have troubles detecting short in battery circuit I will let you know.
Any known problems when battery shorts the mobo?

title: MacBook Pro A1502 820-3476-A 2014 - NO DISPLAY
message: We need some voltage and diode mode readings to diagnose...

title: MacBook Pro A1502 820-3476-A 2014 - NO DISPLAY

Şcreen is working properly after replacing screen cable! I'm so happy, last thing left is problem with battery, if you plug in battery when laptop is working it shuts of, if you connect charger while battery is connected green light is blinking rapidly every second, it blinks green, what is the problem?
I hope not dead smc, wish battery is dead.
Device is working properly withouth battery.

title: MacBook Pro A1502 820-3476-A 2014 - NO DISPLAY
message:
Be sure R/C7125 are good, or Q7130 will burn again.

Use R5115/16 pads, instead of power button; for testing purpose.

title: MacBook Pro A1502 820-3476-A 2014 - NO DISPLAY

title: MacBook Pro A1502 820-3476-A 2014 - NO DISPLAY
message: 18V unstable, it drops from 18V to 5V and goes back to 18V again withouth battery, with battery is max 9V and drops to 5V, blinking green light on charger was device turning on/of rapidly, Q7155?

title: MacBook Pro A1502 820-3476-A 2014 - NO DISPLAY
message:
If you get 18V at PPBUS_G3H, Q7130 is shorted again.

You've said the board worked without battery.
That is not possible with fluctuation 5-18V.
Change Q7130 and U7100 at same time.
Be sure to get good solders and check traces continuity.
Just in case, change C7125; it can't be checked in diode mode.

Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of U7100.
